intro: Seseli natalense, commonly known as Natal seseli, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features finely divided, feather-like leaves and produces small white or pale yellow flowers. Seseli natalense is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
